classification: Industrial Design, Tools, Equipment and Utilitarian Objects
creditline: Gift of funds from Kathleen Bendel
markings: Label, on motor: Electr-O-Matic T.M./UL (inside a circle) FOOD SLICER CSA (intertwined) / R 2020 LR14405 / 115 VOLTS .7AMP.DC-8.AMP.AC / RIVAL MANUFACTURING CO. KANSAS CITY, MO. | Sticker, on food tray: Rival / FOOD SLICER / RIVAL MFG. CO., K.C., MO. | Stamped on bottom: RIVAL MFG. CO. K.C. M.O. / MODEL 2020 PAT. PEND.
medium: Stainless steel, rubber, plastic, electrical components
text: Streamlining was identifiably American. Beginning in the mid-1930s, the idea of speed captivated the nation-appearing fast implied efficiency. All sorts of stationary objects were given casings with rounded corners and fender skirts for their feet. The Rival Company was one of many firms fueling the streamline cause.
title: Electr-O-Matic food slicer, model 2020
